content.description: This route goes up a steep rust colored face on one of largest northwest facing crags in the area. Powerful and technical moves on sharp and smooth edges and polished crystals are experienced on this exceptional climb (4 out of 5 stars).
content.protection: Quick draws for 5 bolts and small to medium cams for an anchor. The descent is an easy walkoff.

climbs.name: My Love Affair with a Wheelbarrow
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Tucker Tech, Tom Burke, Becca Pexiola

content.description: There are two side by side climbs on the rock formation to the left of French Roast/Doggie Style formation.  This is the left one. It goes up fun climbing past a few bolts and takes some gear (mostly thin) too.  It has an anchor on top.  These two climbs are well worth doing after the long hike up to the Johnny Lang Crags.
content.protection: Bolts and some thin gear  (small tcus and stoppers)
content.location: Left of two routes on the same face.

climbs.name: Hibiscus Shuffle
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon , Tucker Tech, Tom Burke, Becca Pexiola

content.description: This is the right of two routes on the section of rock which is to the left of French Roast and Doggie Style.  The climbing is fun, and the route is worth a visit.  There are 2 bolts on the climb, and there are gear placements, mostly thin. The climb has a rap anchor on the top.
content.protection: Quick draws for the bolts, and mostly thin gear for the trad placements.
content.location: This is the right of two routes on this face.

content.description: This thin crack climbs straight up and through a small roof.  The crux is just off the ground with somewhat iffy gear.  Overall a fun route with interesting climbing over the roof.
content.protection: Singles from purple tcu on up.  Single set of small-med nuts.
content.location: The route is located on the left side of the Fissure King Formation.  The start is behind a healthy tree.  White Trash is just to it's right.
